serous otitis media.context: Serous otitis media, better known as middle ear fluid, is the most common condition causing hearing loss in children.

middle ear fluid.context: Serous otitis media, better known as middle ear fluid, is the most common condition causing hearing loss in children.

hearing loss.context: Serous otitis media, better known as middle ear fluid, is the most common condition causing hearing loss in children.

colds.context: This space can become filled with fluid during colds or upper respiratory infections.

upper respiratory infections.context: This space can become filled with fluid during colds or upper respiratory infections.

Eustachian tube.context: Once the cold clears, the fluid will generally drain out of the ear through a tube that connects the middle ear to the nose, the Eustachian tube.

speech delay.context: Because children need hearing to learn speech, hearing loss from fluid in the middle ear can result in speech delay.

mild conductive hearing loss.context: Usually, the presence of fluid results in a "mild conductive hearing loss."

antibiotics.context: After the specialist confirms that fluid is present behind both eardrums, further medical treatment is often advised. This may consist of additional antibiotics, decongestants, and in some cases, nasal sprays.

decongestants.context: After the specialist confirms that fluid is present behind both eardrums, further medical treatment is often advised. This may consist of additional antibiotics, decongestants, and in some cases, nasal sprays.

nasal sprays.context: After the specialist confirms that fluid is present behind both eardrums, further medical treatment is often advised. This may consist of additional antibiotics, decongestants, and in some cases, nasal sprays.

myringotomy and tubes.context: Surgery which drains fluid involves a small incision in the eardrum, so that the fluid can be gently removed and a tube can be inserted. The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tube, (BMT if Bilateral) or PET (Pressure Equalizing Tubes), is performed on children under general anesthesia.

tympanostomy and tube.context: Surgery which drains fluid involves a small incision in the eardrum, so that the fluid can be gently removed and a tube can be inserted. The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tube, (BMT if Bilateral) or PET (Pressure Equalizing Tubes), is performed on children under general anesthesia.

The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tube, (BMT if Bilateral) or PET (Pressure Equalizing Tubes), is performed on children under general anesthesia.

The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tube, (BMT if Bilateral) or PET (Pressure Equalizing Tubes), is performed on children under general anesthesia.
